homeExemptions.postDeathTreatment: subject to recovery only if home passes through probate and no protected heirs survive

recoveryTimeframes.statuteLimit: 4 months from notice by estate representative

criteria: heir would lose primary source of income

incomeDisregards: medical expenses may offset income to meet eligibility

spousalProtections.jointPropertyTreatment: not subject to recovery if it avoids probate
additionalProtections: no recovery from estate of surviving spouse

administrative.agency: Montana Department of Public Health and Human Services (DPHHS)

programEffectiveness.estatesPursued: probate estates containing real estate or financial accounts

effectiveStrategies: avoid probate using revocable trusts, joint ownership, or TOD designations
apply spend-down planning for income excess
request hardship waivers for low-income heirs
retitle property to pass outside probate where allowed
